study_goal: To examine the impact of cryotherapy on spasticity among patients with multiple sclerosis (MS).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy combined with physical therapy significantly reduced calf muscle spasticity in MS patients compared to physical therapy alone, as measured by the modified Ashworth scale and H/M ratio. The study group showed a 33.81% reduction in the H/M ratio, while the control group showed a 19.58% reduction.
population_specificity: Patients with multiple sclerosis experiencing spasticity (n=32).
effective_dosage: Airflow cryotherapy administered three times per week.
study_duration: Twelve consecutive sessions (total intervention duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy as a treatment for chronic rhinitis by analyzing existing literature.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly improved symptoms (rTNSS, RQLQ, and NOSE scores) compared to baseline, with 61% and 52% of patients experiencing complete relief for nasal obstruction and rhinorrhea, respectively. The improvement was consistent across follow-up periods, though more high-quality RCTs are needed for stronger evidence.
population_specificity: 1663 patients with chronic rhinitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) and winter swimming (WS) on antioxidant enzyme levels (catalase, glutathione peroxidase, superoxide dismutase) and their potential health benefits.
results_summary: The study found that WBC increased catalase (CAT) in men and superoxide dismutase (SOD) in women, while winter swimming decreased SOD in men. WS was deemed safe and effective for improving health by enhancing antioxidant defenses, and WBC may aid in treating oxidative stress-related diseases.
population_specificity: 60 participants (30 WBC, 30 WS) and 30 controls, with gender-specific effects noted.
effective_dosage: 20 sessions of WBC or WS (frequency not specified).
study_duration: Duration of intervention not explicitly stated, but involved 20 sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of liquid nitrogen cryotherapy (LNC) as a non-surgical treatment for palatal solitary neurofibromas (SNFs).
results_summary: The study found that LNC successfully resolved a palatal SNF after four treatment sessions, with no recurrence observed at five months. The results suggest LNC may be an effective non-invasive alternative for patients who decline surgery.
population_specificity: A 45-year-old female with a palatal solitary neurofibroma not linked to neurofibromatosis type 1.
effective_dosage: Two 1-2 minute freeze-thaw cycles initially, extended to two 2-2 minute freeze-thaw cycles in subsequent sessions.
study_duration: Four treatment sessions (total duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of a novel carbon dioxide-based cryotherapy device compared to a commercial argon-based device for breast cancer treatment.
results_summary: The carbon dioxide device produced a lethal isotherm comparable to the argon device in tissue phantoms and demonstrated effective necrosis margins in an in vivo canine mammary mass. The study suggests carbon dioxide-based cryotherapy may be equivalent to conventional argon-based methods in ablation zone size.
population_specificity: Canine model (spontaneously occurring mammary mass) and tissue phantoms.
effective_dosage: Two standard 10-minute freezes (in vivo), 45-minute treatment (tissue phantom).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of whole-body cryotherapy (WBCT) as a holistic approach to managing multiple sclerosis (MS) by addressing vascular damage, chronic inflammation, and oxidative imbalance.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that WBCT may alleviate the triad of MS progression factors (vascular dysfunction, neuroinflammation, and oxidative stress) but does not provide specific data on its effectiveness. It highlights the need for multi-targeted therapeutic approaches in MS management.
population_specificity: Patients with multiple sclerosis (MS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the bioeffects and clinical outcomes of cryotherapy versus hyperthermic HIFU in treating inflammatory skin conditions, specifically granuloma annulare.
results_summary: Cryotherapy produced a larger necrotic volume (138.5 mm³) at -92.7°C and resolved lesions but caused scarring and dyspigmentation. HIFU, while generating smaller necrotic volumes (up to 15.99 mm³), achieved full or partial resolution without such adverse effects.
population_specificity: A patient with granuloma annulare (22 lesions treated with HIFU, 10 with cryotherapy).
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy (only temperature and necrotic volume reported).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of radiotherapy for treating localized prostate cancer recurrence after cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that radiotherapy after cryotherapy for prostate cancer recurrence was feasible and effective in local control, with two patients experiencing late grade 3 toxicities and two relapsing after a median follow-up of 5 years. Three patients died of other causes.
population_specificity: Ten patients treated with radiotherapy after cryotherapy for prostate cancer recurrence in Nantes, France (2012-2019).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of cryotherapy on haemostasis, post-operative pain, and the outcome of full pulpotomy in mature permanent teeth with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy achieved haemostasis faster and significantly reduced post-operative pain at 24 and 48 hours compared to conventional pulpotomy, with no adverse effect on the 12-month success rate (88% in both groups).
population_specificity: Sixty mature permanent mandibular molar teeth with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis and no periapical rarefaction.
effective_dosage: Continuous lavage with 2.5°C normal saline solution.
study_duration: Intervention duration was during the procedure; follow-up was 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy, combined with an initial rehabilitation exercise program, improves range of motion, pain, swelling, and gait in patients after total knee arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in knee flexion range of motion, pain, edema, and walking ability in the cryotherapy group compared to the control group, with statistically significant differences (p < 0.05).
population_specificity: Patients who underwent total knee arthroplasty (TKA).
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy was applied six times a week for two weeks, once before and after exercise for 3 minutes each session.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of combining photodynamic therapy (PDT) with liquid nitrogen cryotherapy and curettage for treating intractable periungual and subungual warts.
results_summary: The study reported successful treatment of a case of intractable periungual and subungual warts using PDT combined with cryotherapy and curettage, suggesting potential efficacy for difficult-to-treat warts.
population_specificity: A single case of intractable periungual and subungual warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the most effective and safe cryotherapy method for superficial skin cooling among older women.
results_summary: Bagged ice and gel packs were more effective in reducing superficial skin temperature than bagged ice plus a wet towel, with no significant difference between ice and gel. However, three participants experienced adverse effects with the gel pack.
population_specificity: Older women (mean age 70.0 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pre-puncture application of an ice pack (cryotherapy), EMLA cream, or lidocaine spray could effectively reduce pain associated with arteriovenous fistula puncture in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study found that ice pack application was associated with the lowest pain scores (39.8 ± 13.2) compared to EMLA cream (45 ± 18.4) and lidocaine spray (52.9 ± 15.2), with the control group scoring highest (69.7 ± 15.7). Ice pack use ranked as the most effective method for pain reduction.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients with arteriovenous fistula access in nine Iraqi centers.
effective_dosage: Not specified (ice pack application prior to puncture).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of saline at room temperature, cold saline (2.5°C), and dexamethasone as final irrigants in reducing postoperative pain after single-visit endodontics.
results_summary: Cryotherapy (cold saline) showed lower pain scores compared to room-temperature saline but was less effective than dexamethasone. Pain reduction was significant across all groups, with no notable differences between 12 and 24 hours post-treatment.
population_specificity: Patients requiring single-visit root canal treatment with a baseline pain level of 4 or higher on the VAS.
effective_dosage: 2.5°C cold saline as final irrigant (specific volume not stated).
study_duration: Postoperative pain assessed at 6, 12, and 24 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical efficacy of tranexamic acid effervescent vaginal tablets and cryotherapy in treating symptomatic cervical ectropion.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant difference in symptom cure rates between tranexamic acid and cryotherapy, with both treatments showing significant improvements in symptoms like dyspareunia, pelvic pain, and post-coital bleeding. Cryotherapy was equally effective as tranexamic acid in resolving cervical ectropion (84% vs. 86%).
population_specificity: 92 women with cervical erosive ectropion.
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy (intervention details not provided).
study_duration: Weekly visits for the first month, then monthly for 3 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether adding oral fluconazole to topical cryotherapy improved treatment efficacy and recovery time for Cutaneous Leishmaniasis (CL) lesions.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant difference in lesion reduction or recovery status between cryotherapy alone and cryotherapy plus fluconazole, though the combined treatment showed a slightly higher reduction in lesion surface area. No adverse effects were observed in either group.
population_specificity: 52 participants with Cutaneous Leishmaniasis (CL), with 1 to 8 lesions per participant.
effective_dosage: Weekly cryotherapy with liquid nitrogen; oral fluconazole at 6 mg/kg daily (max 400 mg) for the intervention group.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the latest treatment modalities for solar cheilosis, including cryotherapy, and assess their clinical effectiveness.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the conservative treatment options for solar cheilosis but does not provide specific efficacy data or comparative outcomes.
population_specificity: Individuals with solar cheilosis, particularly those with lighter skin pigmentation and chronic sun exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review diagnostic and management approaches for digital Bowen disease, including the role of cryotherapy among other treatments.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is listed as one of the available treatment alternatives for digital Bowen disease, but the abstract does not provide specific efficacy data or comparative outcomes for cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with digital Bowen disease, a rare type of squamous cell carcinoma in situ affecting digits or nails.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and safety of multimodality therapeutic bronchoscopic interventions, including cryotherapy, for pediatric central airway obstruction and other airway pathologies.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used as an assistive modality in 10% of procedures, contributing to the overall immediate procedural success rate of 92%. Minor procedural complications occurred in 19.4% of cases, but specific adverse effects related to cryotherapy were not detailed.
population_specificity: 72 children (mean age 140 months) with central airway obstruction or other central airway pathologies.
study_duration: Procedures conducted between January 2015 and November 2023.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a multimodal bronchoscopic intervention, including cryotherapy, could effectively and safely treat bronchial schwannoma while preserving lung function.
results_summary: The study found that a single-session multimodal bronchoscopic treatment combining cryotherapy, high-frequency electrocoagulation, and laser therapy successfully resolved the bronchial schwannoma with minimal bleeding and no recurrence at 8-month follow-up. The intervention restored full bronchial patency and avoided surgical resection.
population_specificity: A 69-year-old Chinese woman with an asymptomatic bronchial schwannoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current treatments for retinoblastoma, including cryotherapy, and discuss the potential of immunotherapeutic approaches targeting GD2.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the current treatments for retinoblastoma but does not provide specific findings about its effects. It highlights the adverse effects of existing treatments, including cryotherapy, but focuses more on the promise of immunotherapy.
population_specificity: Infants and children with retinoblastoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of HPV test-and-treat versus cytology-based screening for cervical cancer prevention in women living with HIV, particularly focusing on the prevalence of cervical lesions inappropriate for ablative therapy like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that 17% of women had cervical lesions inappropriate for ablative therapy, with high-risk HPV being more common in these cases. Among women with extensive lesions, 34% had high-grade lesions (bHSIL), and 24% still had bHSIL after loop electro-excision procedure (LEEP) treatment at 26 weeks.
population_specificity: Women living with HIV (WLHIV) in seven countries, predominantly Black/Non-Hispanic, median age 36 years, 80% on ART, 73% with HIV-1 RNA < 200 copies/mL.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether five consecutive days of cold-water immersion (CWI) at 14°C enhances recovery from exercise-induced muscle damage in the hamstrings.
results_summary: The study found that CWI significantly improved recovery compared to the control group, with notable increases in maximum voluntary isometric contraction (MVC) and straight leg raise (SLR), and decreases in delayed onset muscle soreness (DOMS) and plasma myoglobin (Mb) levels.
population_specificity: Eighteen healthy adult women.
effective_dosage: One 14-minute session of CWI at 14°C, administered at 1, 25, 49, 73, and 97 hours post-exercise.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the clinical applications, safety, and efficacy of endoscopic cryotherapy for various gastrointestinal conditions, including Barrett's esophagus and duodenal adenomas.
results_summary: Endoscopic cryotherapy demonstrated safety and efficacy in treating gastrointestinal conditions, achieving complete eradication of dysplasia and neoplasia in Barrett's esophagus. It also showed promise as a second-line treatment for refractory cases and as an alternative to surgical resection for duodenal adenomas.
population_specificity: Patients with gastrointestinal conditions, including Barrett's esophagus, duodenal adenomas, and refractory esophageal strictures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand how cold interventions (Cryotherapy) impact long-term training adaptations, particularly skeletal muscle adaptations, protein turnover, and satellite cell activation.
results_summary: The study found that cold interventions can blunt molecular adaptations (e.g., protein synthesis and satellite cell activation) and oxi-inflammatory responses after resistance exercise, leading to diminished exercise-induced hypertrophy and lower gains in isometric strength.
population_specificity: Athletes and individuals undergoing resistance exercise training, with some references to rodent models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of cold therapy (cryotherapy) compared to other non-pharmacological interventions for pain relief following chest tube removal in adult patients.
results_summary: Cold therapy significantly reduced pain immediately after chest tube removal and up to ten to twenty minutes post-removal, with standardized mean differences (SMD) of -1.84 and -1.96, respectively. It was ranked among the most effective interventions, alongside relaxation exercises, with no noted adverse effects.
population_specificity: Adult patients undergoing chest tube removal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a local therapy for oligometastatic prostate cancer (OMPCa) in comparison to other treatments like cytoreductive prostatectomy and radiotherapy.
results_summary: The evidence for cryotherapy in treating OMPCa remains limited, with further clinical trials required to establish its effectiveness. The abstract does not provide specific outcomes or data supporting cryotherapy's efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with newly diagnosed oligometastatic prostate cancer (OMPCa).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy as a treatment option for porokeratosis among other available therapies.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that cryotherapy is one of several treatment options for porokeratosis, but none are fully effective, and outcomes vary significantly based on the type of porokeratosis and patient characteristics.
population_specificity: Patients with various clinical variants of porokeratosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review various treatment modalities for keloids, including cryotherapy, to assess their effectiveness and potential use in clinical practice.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the treatment options for keloids but does not provide specific results regarding its efficacy or outcomes compared to other methods.
population_specificity: Patients with keloids (no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of daily cold-water immersions on biochemical, clinical, and neuromuscular markers of muscle damage in soccer players during preseason.
results_summary: Cold-water immersion at 10°C for 10 minutes significantly reduced creatine kinase (CK) concentration compared to the control group, but no differences were observed in vertical jump performance, strength, or perception of recovery.
population_specificity: Under-20 semi-professional male soccer players.
effective_dosage: 10 minutes daily in a bathtub with water and ice at 10°C ± 1°C.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the oncological efficacy and complications of cryoablation in treating peripheral lung metastases from colorectal cancer.
results_summary: Cryoablation achieved high local control rates (95% at 1 year, 89% at 2-4 years) with predominantly mild or moderate complications and a low incidence of severe complications. Distant progression occurred in 56.2% of patients, significantly associated with a history of liver metastasis and synchronous lung metastasis.
population_specificity: Patients with histologically confirmed colorectal cancer and radiologically confirmed peripheral lung metastases (≤2 cm from pleura).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the current therapeutic landscape for warts and molluscum contagiosum, including the role of cryotherapy as a principal treatment option.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy remains a principal treatment option for warts and molluscum contagiosum, alongside newer therapies. It highlighted the need for personalized treatment strategies but did not provide specific efficacy data for cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with warts and molluscum contagiosum (general population, no specific subgroup mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the latest data on the management of oligometastatic breast cancer (OMBC), including the potential role of cryotherapy as a local eradication therapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy's effects but highlights that local therapies like cryotherapy could offer long-term outcomes in OMBC patients. It emphasizes the lack of sufficient data and the need for multidisciplinary approaches in managing OMBC.
population_specificity: Patients with oligometastatic breast cancer (OMBC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of superficial heat-cold application on sleep quality in patients with restless leg syndrome (RLS).
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed that superficial heat-cold application improved sleep quality in RLS patients (SMD = 0.685). Higher temperatures increased effectiveness, while longer session durations and older age reduced the intervention's efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with restless leg syndrome (RLS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the efficacy, safety, oncologic, and functional outcomes of focal treatments, including cryotherapy, for prostate cancer.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was noted as one of the most studied focal techniques, showing superior functional outcomes compared to radical treatments but associated with higher recurrence and retreatment rates. Limited data exist comparing cryotherapy to standardized radical treatments.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer patients, particularly those with low or favorable-intermediate risk disease, unfit for radical options.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the overall complication rate and incidence of cryoshock in patients undergoing cryoablation for liver malignancies.
results_summary: The study found that cryoablation has a relatively safe profile with a pooled incidence of major complications below 5%, and cryoshock occurred in less than 0.3% of procedures, not reported for liver lesions smaller than 3 cm.
population_specificity: Patients with liver malignancies undergoing percutaneous cryoablation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy in treating benign skin lesions, such as acrochordons and seborrheic keratoses, and its suitability for different skin types.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was identified as a common treatment for acrochordons and seborrheic keratoses, with noted risks of hypopigmentation in patients with darker skin. The abstract does not provide specific efficacy data but implies its use is standard for certain benign lesions.
population_specificity: Patients with benign skin tumors, including those with darker skin types.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of cryotherapy as a treatment option for dermatosis papulosa nigra (DPN) in individuals with skin of color.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was identified as one of several treatment options for DPN, with varying outcomes and potential adverse effects, including postinflammatory hyperpigmentation. The study noted that adverse effects could be mitigated with topical treatments aimed at reducing inflammation.
population_specificity: Adults with dermatosis papulosa nigra (DPN), particularly those with skin of color.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of precision cryotherapy as a treatment for scalp Seborrheic Dermatitis (SD).
results_summary: Precision cryotherapy was successfully used to treat scalp SD, showing significant efficacy in small cohorts with high patient satisfaction. The abstract does not provide detailed statistical outcomes or adverse effects specific to cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Human patients with Seborrheic Dermatitis (SD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to consolidate existing research on the pathogenesis, clinical diagnosis, imaging outcomes, and conservative treatments of Sinding-Larsen-Johansson disease (SLJD), including the role of cryotherapy.
results_summary: The review found that conservative treatment, including cryotherapy, yields positive outcomes for SLJD within two to eight months, though the evidence is limited and primarily derived from case studies.
population_specificity: Physically active adolescents aged 9-17 years, particularly males.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature to determine the management options for intraprostatic recurrence of prostate cancer, including the role of cryotherapy as a salvage local therapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy is one of several salvage local therapy options for intraprostatic recurrence, but it did not specifically compare its efficacy or safety to other modalities like HDR brachytherapy or SBRT.
population_specificity: Patients with intraprostatic recurrence of prostate cancer after radiation therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the tangible effect of cryotherapy as part of a combined intervention (sham IAPT, IFT, and cryotherapy) on trigger points and posture in individuals with non-specific low back pain and hyperlordosis.
results_summary: The study found that the placebo group (which included cryotherapy) showed improvements in pressure pain threshold (PPT) and disability (MODI) comparable to the IAPT group, but cryotherapy's specific effects were not isolated or directly assessed.
population_specificity: Thirty-two participants with non-specific low back pain and lumbar hyperlordosis.
effective_dosage: Alternate days over two weeks (specific cryotherapy parameters not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy as a treatment option for xanthoma disseminatum (XD) by analyzing existing literature.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used in 6 out of 99 cases, achieving a complete response rate (CRR) of 16.7% (1/6). This suggests modest efficacy compared to other treatments, with cladribine showing the highest CRR (27.1%).
population_specificity: Patients with xanthoma disseminatum (XD), a rare normolipidemic mucocutaneous xanthomatosis (166 cases: 106 females, 60 males; mean age 35.3 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryo-pneumatic compression compared to standard cryotherapy in reducing postoperative shoulder pain, narcotic use, and improving quality of life.
results_summary: Patients receiving cryo-pneumatic compression showed significantly decreased opioid consumption and improved function at 2 weeks postoperatively compared to standard care. The study also noted increased recovery and reduced pain scores in the intervention group.
population_specificity: 200 patients older than 18 years scheduled for unilateral shoulder surgery.
study_duration: Outcomes evaluated at 2, 6, and 12 weeks postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of nonthermal atmospheric plasma (NTAP) versus standard of care (SOC) cryotherapy for treating verruca vulgaris (VV) in children.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a 60.7% complete resolution rate for VV lesions, but patients reported more post-treatment pain compared to NTAP. No significant adverse events were noted for either treatment.
population_specificity: Mostly White (92.9%) male (71.4%) children with a mean age of 9.5 years.
effective_dosage: Treatments administered at 4-week intervals for a maximum of 3 sessions.
study_duration: Up to 12 weeks (3 treatments) with a 4-week post-treatment follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy and photobiomodulation in reducing pain and improving healing in postpartum women with grade I and II perineal lacerations or episiotomy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was less effective than photobiomodulation in reducing pain and improving healing, with statistically significant differences favoring photobiomodulation both immediately postpartum (p=0.008) and after 24 hours (p<0.001).
population_specificity: Postpartum women with grade I and II perineal lacerations or episiotomy within 12 hours of delivery.
study_duration: Immediate postpartum period (up to 12 hours) and follow-up at 24 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of cryotherapy, among other therapies, in the window of opportunity (WOO) setting for early-stage triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) patients, to assess its pharmacodynamic and clinical effects.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results for cryotherapy, but mentions that the WOO design is suitable for testing cryotherapy in combination with other therapies to measure effects in treatment-naive TNBC patients. Some patients showed good responses to immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICIs) in WOO studies, but cryotherapy-specific outcomes are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with early-stage triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of cryotherapy in treating lesion recurrences in participants with cutaneous leishmaniasis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy successfully treated lesion recurrences in two participants, with no severe or serious adverse events reported, though scarring was noted due to the combination of CL and biopsy procedures.
population_specificity: 14 participants exposed to Leishmania major-infected sand flies, with 10 developing clinically compatible lesions.
study_duration: Lesion recurrences treated 4-8 months after biopsy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether machine-controlled cooling of hands and feet could reduce nail toxicity and chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) in patients receiving taxane chemotherapy.
results_summary: Cooling showed a clinically meaningful reduction in CIPN occurrence, particularly for Paclitaxel, and a significant benefit over time for nail toxicity in Docetaxel-treated patients. The intervention was well tolerated.
population_specificity: Patients receiving Docetaxel or Paclitaxel chemotherapy (69 total, 21 Docetaxel, 48 Paclitaxel).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the oncological outcomes and safety of salvage cryotherapy for radio-recurrent prostate cancer.
results_summary: The abstract highlights promising oncological outcomes for salvage cryotherapy, with an overall 5-year survival rate of around 85%, but notes incontinence rates of about 30% depending on patient risk factors and study definitions.
population_specificity: Patients with biochemical recurrence of prostate cancer following radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically appraise evidence-based clinical practice guidelines (EB-CPGs) related to acute ankle injuries, including the role of cryotherapy in management.
results_summary: The study highlighted cryotherapy as valuable guidance for ankle injury management, but the overall quality of existing EB-CPGs was not strong, with some being outdated.
population_specificity: Adults with acute ankle injuries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cost-effectiveness and health outcomes of cryotherapy versus thermocoagulation for cervical cancer screening in Malawi, particularly focusing on screening frequency and HIV status.
results_summary: Thermocoagulation was found to be more cost-effective than cryotherapy at all screening frequencies. Screening once per decade with 100% treatment coverage was more cost-effective than more frequent screening with lower treatment rates.
population_specificity: Malawian women, with a focus on those with high cervical cancer burden and HIV prevalence.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and treatment options for acquired epidermodysplasia verruciformis (AEV), including cryotherapy, in immunodeficient patients, particularly those with HIV.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was mentioned as one of the treatments used in combination with other therapies (e.g., glycolic acid, 5-fluorouracil, imiquimod, topical retinoids), but most treatments, including cryotherapy, showed low efficacy. The study did not provide specific outcomes for cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Immunodeficient patients, particularly those with HIV and acquired epidermodysplasia verruciformis (AEV).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent evidence on bronchoscopic interventions, including cryotherapy, for managing COPD, particularly chronic bronchitis.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several interventional procedures being investigated for COPD-related mucus hypersecretion and cough, but no specific results for cryotherapy are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with COPD, particularly those with the chronic bronchitis phenotype.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of cryotreated (cold) and warm sodium hypochlorite (NaOCl) on postoperative pain in patients with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis and symptomatic apical periodontitis.
results_summary: The cold NaOCl group had significantly lower postoperative pain scores at all follow-up intervals compared to the control and warm NaOCl groups, with statistically significant differences at 6 and 72 hours. None of the subjects in the control and cold NaOCl groups experienced postoperative discomfort at 72 hours.
population_specificity: Sixty-six individuals with symptomatic irreversible pulpitis and symptomatic apical periodontitis in mandibular molars, with preoperative pain scores ≥54 mm on the HP-VAS.
study_duration: Postoperative pain assessed at 6, 24, 48, and 72 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review advanced diagnostic and therapeutic flexible bronchoscopy techniques in children, including Cryotherapy's potential to spare patients more invasive procedures.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the use of advanced bronchoscopy techniques for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes in children but does not specifically detail Cryotherapy's effects.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients requiring advanced bronchoscopy procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of cryotherapy and other physical modalities in managing chronic pruritus.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that cryotherapy is an emerging treatment option for chronic pruritus, but it is still partly experimental. The study suggests it may offer antipruritic effects, though detailed results are not provided.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic pruritus (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of focal therapy (including cryotherapy) for unfavorable intermediate-risk prostate cancer (GG3).
results_summary: Focal therapy for GG3 prostate cancer showed in-field biopsy recurrence rates of ~20%, but failure-free survival and overall survival exceeded 90%. Salvage therapy was effective for local recurrences, preserving quality of life without compromising survival.
population_specificity: Patients with localized low-volume unfavorable intermediate-risk prostate cancer (GG3).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore oncology clinicians' self-reported practices and perceptions regarding CIPN prevention and management, including the use of cryotherapy.
results_summary: Clinicians observed cryotherapy being used for CIPN prevention, but its use was complicated by discomfort and efficacy concerns. The study did not provide specific efficacy data for cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Oncology clinicians and cancer survivors experiencing chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore treatment options for eyelid malignancies, including cryotherapy, as part of non-surgical interventions.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several non-surgical treatment options for eyelid malignancies, but no specific outcomes or comparative efficacy data are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with eyelid malignancies, including basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and other types.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of portable thermal ablation (TA) to standard cryotherapy and electrosurgical excision (LLETZ) for treating cervical precancer in a resource-limited setting.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a treatment success rate of 71.1%, comparable to TA (74.0%) and LLETZ (71.4%), demonstrating noninferiority. Moderate-to-severe pain was reported by 6.5% of cryotherapy recipients, higher than TA (3.6%) but lower than LLETZ (1.9%).
population_specificity: 3,124 women in Zambia with cervical precancer, positive on visual inspection with acetic acid and eligible for ablative therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a novel dermal cooling system (DCS) for reducing pigmentation in benign pigmented lesions in Asian patients.
results_summary: The study found that 76.5% and 58.6% of treatment sites showed obvious to marked improvement at 2 months posttreatment, with sustained results at 6 and 12 months. Adverse events were minor, with erythema and edema being common but minimal pain and low incidence (2.2%) of postinflammatory hyperpigmentation.
population_specificity: Asian patients with benign pigmented lesions (lentigines, melasma, nevus spilus, ephelides, café au lait, and seborrheic keratosis).
effective_dosage: DCS applied at Week 0 and repeated at 4-week intervals up to 10 sessions.
study_duration: Up to 10 sessions over approximately 40 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to update the global evidence-based consensus guideline on the management of desmoid tumors, including the positioning of local therapies like cryotherapy in the treatment algorithm.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the local ablative therapies considered in the 2023 consensus guideline, but specific results regarding its effects are not detailed. The guideline emphasizes a multidisciplinary approach and individualized treatment strategies.
population_specificity: Patients with desmoid tumors, including both adult and pediatric cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the management options for myofascial-related chronic pelvic pain, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the treatment modalities for myofascial pelvic pain, but no specific data on its effectiveness is provided. Other adjunct modalities are noted to have sparse effectiveness data.
population_specificity: Patients with myofascial-related chronic pelvic pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the benefits and harms of heel lifts, including cryotherapy, for lower limb musculoskeletal conditions.
results_summary: The study found very low to low certainty evidence for cryotherapy's effects, with no clinically meaningful differences in most outcomes. Only two out of 47 outcomes showed significant effects, but confidence in these results is limited due to low evidence quality.
population_specificity: Individuals with mid-portion Achilles tendinopathy, calcaneal apophysitis, and plantar heel pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore recent advances in stereotactic ablative body radiotherapy (SABR) for localized renal cell carcinoma (RCC), including patient selection, treatment modalities, and efficacy assessment, rather than focusing on cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy; it primarily discusses SABR's efficacy (70-100% local control rates) and safety (rare, mild toxicities) for RCC.
population_specificity: Elderly and frail patients with localized RCC who are not suitable candidates for surgical resection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of photoacoustic imaging (PAI) to improve the precision and monitoring of cryotherapy for prostate cancer treatment.
results_summary: PAI enables non-invasive monitoring of cryotherapy, enhancing treatment precision and success by providing real-time imaging and temperature monitoring during thermal therapies. The study suggests PAI could improve diagnostic accuracy and therapeutic guidance for prostate cancer.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer patients (not explicitly specified, inferred from context).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the role of cryotherapy among existing keloid treatment methods.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings regarding cryotherapy's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as part of a multimodal treatment approach for retinoblastoma, focusing on its effectiveness in eye salvage.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was identified as one of the focal consolidation therapies used alongside intraarterial or intravenous chemotherapy, contributing to less aggressive treatment modalities for retinoblastoma. The abstract suggests it is part of an effective multimodality approach, though specific outcomes for cryotherapy alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with retinoblastoma, particularly in developing countries with high prevalence rates and delayed healthcare access.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy, among other physical therapy interventions, alters spinal excitability in patients with chronic ankle instability (CAI).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that cryotherapy, along with other interventions, did not significantly alter spinal excitability in patients with CAI. The study noted that more research is needed to validate the efficacy of these interventions.
population_specificity: Athletes with chronic ankle instability (CAI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether high-frequency vibration combined with cryotherapy reduces pain during influenza vaccination in adults.
results_summary: The study found that participants using the device reported lower mean pain scores (1.5 ±1.7) compared to the control group (1.9 ±1.9), with statistical significance (p = .041). Higher pain levels were associated with the control group, females, higher expected pain, and higher anxiety levels.
population_specificity: 350 adults receiving the influenza vaccine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of cryotherapy as a preventative option for cancer-induced madarosis (eyebrow and eyelash loss).
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy is a promising preventative option for madarosis, but robust research is needed to confirm its efficacy and quality. No specific results on cryotherapy's effects are provided.
population_specificity: Patients experiencing eyebrow and eyelash loss secondary to chemotherapy, endocrine therapies, and radiation therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness of pharmacotherapy, including cryotherapy, for treating keloids and hypertrophic scars, particularly in preventing postsurgical recurrence.
results_summary: The study found that multimodal combination pharmacotherapy, which may include cryotherapy, is more effective than monotherapy for treating keloids and hypertrophic scars, though results on individual treatments were inconsistent.
population_specificity: Individuals with keloids (KD) and hypertrophic scars (HTS), particularly those with a family history or genetic predisposition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in restoring airway patency in a pediatric TB case with bronchial obstruction.
results_summary: Cryotherapy successfully recanalized the obstructed bronchus intermedius, leading to restored airway patency confirmed by follow-up bronchoscopy. The study highlights its potential efficacy but notes a lack of broader knowledge about its use in children.
population_specificity: HIV-positive pediatric patient (child under 15 years) with TB-related bronchial obstruction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy combined with standard postoperative treatment in reducing swelling and pain in patients undergoing orthognathic surgery.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with standard treatment (Group SD) resulted in a 2.63% reduction in facial swelling, while the addition of PEMF (Group SD + PEMF) showed a 6.23% reduction. Pain scores were significantly higher in the cryotherapy-only group compared to the PEMF-enhanced group.
population_specificity: 30 patients aged ≥18 years with Class III malocclusion undergoing Le Fort I osteotomy and Bilateral Sagittal Split Osteotomy (BSSO).
study_duration: Assessments were made at 1 and 4 days post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the effectiveness of photodynamic therapy (PDT) for recalcitrant plantar warts, noting that cryotherapy was ineffective for these cases.
results_summary: The study reported three cases of recalcitrant plantar warts successfully treated with PDT, suggesting it as an alternative when traditional cryotherapy fails. The abstract does not provide detailed efficacy data for cryotherapy itself.
population_specificity: Patients with recalcitrant plantar warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the physiological impacts of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) on various systems and its clinical applications in musculoskeletal ailments.
results_summary: WBC shows promise in improving bone health in athletes and providing relief for osteoarthritis and fibromyalgia, but evidence is less robust for chronic pain syndromes and osteomyelitis. Risks like frostbite and impaired muscle strength were noted.
population_specificity: Patients with musculoskeletal ailments, including fractures, osteoarthritis, osteonecrosis, osteomyelitis, adhesive capsulitis, tendinopathies, rheumatic pathologies, chronic pain syndromes, and fibromyalgia, as well as athletes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze cervical cancer screening guidelines in the SADC region, including the use of cryotherapy for treatment, and compare them to WHO recommendations.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was commonly recommended for treating cervical pre-cancer lesions in the SADC region, though adherence to WHO guidelines was lacking. Most countries supported cryotherapy and loop excision as treatment methods.
population_specificity: Women in the Southern African Development Community (SADC) region.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of non-pharmacological strategies, including cryotherapy, in managing dysgeusia in oncology patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy.
results_summary: The review identified cryotherapy as a promising intervention for mitigating taste alterations in oncology patients, though the evidence was limited by small sample sizes and geographical differences.
population_specificity: Oncology patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy experiencing dysgeusia.

study_goal: To evaluate the effects of repeated cold-water immersion (CWI) on performance and perceptive outcomes in competitive adolescent swimmers during a training week.
results_summary: Repeated CWI did not impact functional or swim performance compared to thermoneutral water immersion or passive recovery. Athletes reported similar perceptive outcomes across interventions but preferred CWI or TWI over passive recovery.
population_specificity: Competitive adolescent swimmers (n=20)
effective_dosage: 14 ± 1 °C cold-water immersion, three times a week
study_duration: 1 week per intervention with a 1-week wash-out period

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize variations in postinjection protocols, including cryotherapy use, in studies assessing the clinical efficacy of PRP for knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy use was mentioned as part of postinjection protocols, but the abstract does not provide specific findings on its effects. The study highlights significant heterogeneity in post-PRP injection protocols, with limited rationale for the outlined recommendations.
population_specificity: Patients with knee osteoarthritis receiving PRP injections.

study_goal: The researchers compared the efficacy of topical 5FU 1% as a primary versus secondary treatment for OSSN, which included cases where cryotherapy was used as a prior intervention.
results_summary: The study did not specifically evaluate cryotherapy's efficacy or safety but included it as one of the prior treatments in the secondary 5FU group. No direct outcomes for cryotherapy were reported.
population_specificity: 73 patients with unilateral moderate to extensive ocular surface squamous neoplasia (OSSN).

study_goal: The researchers were examining treatment options for primary invasive squamous cell carcinoma of the nipple, including cryotherapy, but did not specifically evaluate its safety or efficacy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several treatment options for cutaneous SCC but does not provide specific results or outcomes related to its use.
population_specificity: A male patient with primary invasive squamous cell carcinoma of the nipple.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop consensus recommendations on MRI acquisition, interpretation, and reporting after focal therapy for prostate cancer, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study produced the TARGET consensus recommendations, which include performing routine MRI at 12 months using a multiparametric protocol compliant with PI-RADS standards and avoiding PI-RADS category scores for assessing recurrence within the ablation zone. An alternative 5-point scoring system was presented, with focal nodular strong early enhancement on DCE sequences being the most suspicious imaging finding.
population_specificity: Experts in urology, radiology, and pathology from Europe and North America with experience across eight focal therapy modalities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review non-pharmacological interventions, including cryotherapy, for managing chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) in breast cancer patients.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the investigated interventions but does not provide specific results for it, indicating mixed or inconclusive evidence for non-pharmacological approaches overall.
population_specificity: Breast cancer survivors experiencing CIPN (1528 out of 1895 total patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a self-operated ice roller in relieving pruritus, improving sleep quality, and enhancing quality of life in hemodialysis patients with chronic kidney disease-associated pruritus.
results_summary: The ice roller significantly reduced overall pruritus and improved sleep quality and quality of life in hemodialysis patients, serving as an effective adjunct therapy alongside conventional treatments.
population_specificity: 60 hemodialysis patients in Taiwan with chronic pruritus (5D-Itch Scale score >5) lasting over 4 weeks.
effective_dosage: Not specified (ice roller used as needed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of cryotherapy applied to the nail fold in juvenile ingrown toenails (IGTN).
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed good efficacy in 91.7% of patients, with 54.5% remaining in remission after 6 months. Significant improvements in pain and quality of life scores were observed, though recurrence rates were high (45.5%).
population_specificity: Adolescent patients aged 12 to 16 years with unilateral juvenile IGTN.
effective_dosage: Liquid nitrogen sprayed into the nail fold for 10 to 15 seconds with a double freeze-thaw cycle.
study_duration: Single session with follow-up over 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of nonsurgical salvage therapies, including cryotherapy, for localized prostate cancer patients who experienced recurrence after primary radiotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed the highest 5-year biochemical control rate (0.52) among the studied therapies and had a low rate of grade ≥3 genitourinary toxicities (0.09). It demonstrated relatively steady efficacy with acceptable treatment-related toxicities.
population_specificity: Localized prostate cancer patients with recurrence after primary radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of minimally invasive techniques, including cryoablation, in managing early, good-prognosis breast cancer to reduce treatment burden and avoid surgery.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that data on minimally invasive techniques like cryoablation are promising, indicating a potential trend toward their use for early breast cancer as technical skills and follow-up protocols improve. Ongoing trials and published evidence support their benefits, though specific outcomes for cryotherapy are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with early, good-prognosis breast cancer detected by screening programs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the efficacy of non-systemic treatments, including cryotherapy, for prurigo nodularis (PN).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy may be a lesion-directed agent to address adherence challenges and avoid systemic medication, but only one study on cryotherapy was included, limiting conclusive evidence.
population_specificity: Patients with prurigo nodularis (PN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy in treating multiple instances of Bowen's disease, particularly in a patient with a history of psoriasis vulgaris.
results_summary: Cryotherapy using liquid nitrogen was effective in treating Bowen's disease with no recurrence observed during a one-year follow-up period. The study suggests cryotherapy as a viable treatment option for such cases.
population_specificity: An elderly male with a 30-year history of psoriasis vulgaris and subsequent multiple Bowen's disease lesions.
study_duration: Treatment duration not specified, but follow-up was one year.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review whether natural products could help treat keloid disease, comparing them to existing therapies like cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy's effects, focusing instead on natural products and their potential mechanisms.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of keloid disease treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a local treatment option for oligometastatic prostate cancer (OMPC) in combination with androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) or systemic chemotherapy.
results_summary: Whole gland cryotherapy, when combined with ADT or ADT and systemic chemotherapy, showed limited promising results for managing OMPC, though robust clinical data are lacking. The abstract highlights the need for further studies to confirm its efficacy.
population_specificity: Men with oligometastatic prostate cancer (OMPC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of 6 weeks of cryotherapy plus compression therapy on pain, functioning, and patient satisfaction after total knee arthroplasty (TKA) or unicompartmental knee arthroplasty (UKA).
results_summary: The abstract indicates beneficial short-term effects of cryotherapy on pain and opioid use, but the effectiveness of a longer intervention period (6 weeks) on longer-term outcomes remains unclear. The study is ongoing, so definitive results are not yet available.
population_specificity: Patients over age 18 with end-stage osteoarthritis planned for TKA or UKA.
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy plus compression therapy for 6 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of dairy avoidance on prostate cancer patients based on observational and limited RCT evidence.
results_summary: Observational evidence suggests a need for further exploration of dairy avoidance in prostate cancer patients, but no RCT data confirms its benefit or harm. Published trials indicate no benefit from dairy consumption in this context.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of bioactive-enriched dairy products in improving risk factors of metabolic syndrome (MetS) and assess their feasibility, consumer acceptability, and gastrointestinal tolerance.
results_summary: The study found that specific bioactive combinations within the dairy matrix had effects on serum triglyceride or HDL-cholesterol levels without adverse effects, suggesting potential benefits for MetS prevention.
population_specificity: Adult volunteers (74 male, 93 female) with metabolic syndrome risk factors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the associations between dietary intake of dairy and lipid-lowering therapy (LLT) use in Australian adults.
results_summary: The study analyzed dietary intake patterns but did not report specific outcomes regarding dairy's effects on health or LLT efficacy. Associations were examined using quantile regression, but no definitive conclusions about dairy's impact were provided.
population_specificity: Australian adults aged ≥25 years from the AusDiab study (1999-2005).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between dairy product intake and specific fatty acids (C15:0, C17:0, and t-C16:1n-7) in adolescents.
results_summary: At 12 months, erythrocyte C15:0 increased in the group consuming ≥4 dairy servings/day, and dairy intake positively correlated with erythrocyte C15:0 levels. No differences in fatty acids were observed at baseline or 6 months.
population_specificity: Healthy adolescents

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether a Mediterranean-style diet with low to moderate dairy intake could reduce adverse pregnancy outcomes in high-risk women.
results_summary: The study found no significant reduction in composite maternal or offspring outcomes with the Mediterranean-style diet, though it noted a potential reduction in gestational diabetes and gestational weight gain. Dairy intake was reduced as part of the intervention, but specific effects of dairy were not isolated.
population_specificity: Inner-city pregnant women with metabolic risk factors (obesity, chronic hypertension, or hypertriglyceridaemia).
effective_dosage: Low to moderate intake of dairy products (exact amounts not specified).
study_duration: Intervention administered from 18 to 28 weeks' gestation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of food (including dairy) and calcium carbonate on the pharmacokinetics of lusutrombopag in healthy subjects.
results_summary: The study found no significant impact of food (including dairy) or calcium carbonate on lusutrombopag pharmacokinetics, suggesting no need for dietary restrictions during administration.
population_specificity: Healthy adult subjects
effective_dosage: Single doses of 0.75 mg, 2 mg, and 4 mg lusutrombopag
interactions: None mentioned with dairy; calcium carbonate coadministration showed no significant effect.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the long-term effects of infant feeding choices (breastfeeding vs. higher or lower protein formula) and other early programming factors on the plasma metabolome in children.
results_summary: The study found no significant long-term effects of infant feeding choices (higher vs. lower protein formula) or other early programming factors on the plasma metabolome at ages 5.5 and 8 years.
population_specificity: Healthy infants from a European multicenter study, followed up at ages 5.5 and 8 years.
effective_dosage: Not specified (higher vs. lower protein content formula).
study_duration: First year of life (intervention), with follow-up at 5.5 and 8 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of high-calcium fat-free milk versus a low-calcium control diet on adiposity and glycaemic control in individuals with type 2 diabetes and low habitual calcium intake.
results_summary: The study found that high-calcium fat-free milk consumption led to greater reductions in body weight, body fat mass, waist circumference, and improved glycaemic control (lower HbA1c, increased HOMA2-%B) compared to the low-calcium control. Additionally, serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D increased, while serum uric acid and parathormone decreased.
population_specificity: Fourteen subjects with type 2 diabetes (mean age 49.5 years, BMI 29.4 kg/m², habitual calcium intake <600 mg/day).
effective_dosage: 700 mg of calcium daily via a breakfast shake (high-calcium group) or 6.4 mg (low-calcium control). Total dietary calcium intake was ~1200 mg/day (high-calcium) or ~525 mg/day (low-calcium).
study_duration: Two 12-week experimental sessions separated by an 8-week washout.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of a cognitive-behavioral treatment (CBT) program on dietary changes, including dairy consumption, among overweight Iranian adolescents.
results_summary: The CBT group significantly increased their dairy consumption compared to the treatment-as-usual group during the 6-month follow-up (p < 0.001). No adverse effects or safety concerns related to dairy were reported.
population_specificity: Overweight Iranian adolescents (mean age ~14.7 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether a lifestyle modification program could improve dietary quality, specifically focusing on dairy intake (low-fat/saturated fat foods), in women with previous gestational diabetes.
results_summary: The study found a significant improvement in the dairy sub-category of the Australian Recommended Food Score (ARFS) for the intervention group compared to usual care, with a small effect size (Cohen's D = 0.14). However, total diet quality remained low, and the overall impact on dietary habits was modest.
population_specificity: Women with previous gestational diabetes, predominantly within their first postnatal year.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the diagnostic accuracy of the Lactose Breath Test (LBT) and genetic evaluation for lactose intolerance in symptomatic adults.
results_summary: The study found an 88.6% congruency between LBT and genetic tests, with some discrepancies attributed to age or secondary lactose intolerance. Symptoms were reported by 90% of patients during LBT, suggesting clinical utility for combined testing.
population_specificity: Symptomatic adult subjects (not representative of the general population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of a high-dairy diet (HDD) compared to a low-dairy diet (LDD) on blood pressure in overweight middle-aged adults.
results_summary: Consumption of an HDD resulted in a significant reduction in both systolic and diastolic blood pressure compared to an LDD, with reductions appearing dependent on increased calcium intake.
population_specificity: Overweight middle-aged men and women (n=52).
effective_dosage: HDD: 6 reduced-fat dairy portions per day for men, 5 for women; LDD: ≤1 dairy portion per day.
study_duration: 6 weeks per diet, with a 4-week washout period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of vitamin D in calcium and phosphate homeostasis, its deficiency consequences, and the impact of fortification (including in dairy products) on global vitamin D status.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that vitamin D fortification in dairy and other foods has significantly reduced rickets in Western countries, but deficiency remains prevalent worldwide. It also summarizes new insights into vitamin D metabolism and clinical syndromes related to its deficiency.
population_specificity: General population (children and adults)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between atopy markers, persistent airflow limitation (PAL), and occupational exposure in dairy farmers.
results_summary: Dairy farmers with PAL showed higher rates of atopy markers, including polysensitization and sensitization to seasonal and food allergens, compared to controls. No significant differences in atopy markers were found between non-farming PAL patients and their controls.
population_specificity: Dairy farmers and non-farming subjects, both with and without persistent airflow limitation (PAL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary carbohydrate intolerance, rather than obesity itself, is a fundamental feature of metabolic syndrome (MetS) and how low-carbohydrate/high-fat diets impact MetS markers.
results_summary: The study found that low-carbohydrate intake improved fat oxidation and reversed MetS markers, including high triglycerides, low HDL-C, and abnormal fatty acid composition, despite maintaining body mass. The LC diet also reduced plasma total saturated fat and palmitoleate while increasing arachidonate, even with higher saturated fat content.
population_specificity: Obese individuals diagnosed with metabolic syndrome (MetS).
effective_dosage: Not specified (diets varied in carbohydrate content: low, moderate, and high, with constant protein and isocaloric fat exchange).
study_duration: 4 weeks per diet (total 12 weeks for all three diets).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify molecular mechanisms regulating gene expression in response to E. coli mastitis in dairy cows to improve diagnosis and treatment strategies.
results_summary: The study identified key upstream regulators (e.g., TP53, SP1, INS, IFNG, EGF) and downstream targets (e.g., MAPK3, MAPK8, VEGFA, IL10) of differentially expressed genes involved in immune response and inflammation, providing insights for mastitis management.
population_specificity: Dairy cows affected by E. coli mastitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate meal patterns across demographic characteristics in middle-aged and older US adults.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings related to Dairy's effects.
population_specificity: Noninstitutionalized middle-aged and older US adults (45-59 years and older) from the 2005-2016 National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare anthropometric measurements, food intake, and serum vitamin levels in children with cow's milk allergy (CMA) versus healthy controls.
results_summary: Children with CMA had shorter height, lower calcium and lipid intake, and insufficient serum levels of vitamins A and D compared to healthy controls.
population_specificity: 27 children with CMA and 30 healthy controls, mean age four years (±1.9).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide a technical opinion supporting recommendations for milk and dairy consumption in adults and older adults, addressing nutritional benefits, safety, and potential health associations.
results_summary: The study highlights milk's high bioavailability of macronutrients and accessibility but notes gaps in physician knowledge about nutrition. It discusses milk's nutritional profile, intolerance issues, and associations with digestive tract alterations, though pediatric effects were excluded.
population_specificity: Adults and older adults (pediatric stage excluded).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of polar lipids, including those from dairy, in cognitive development and assess the potential benefits of supplementation.
results_summary: The study found that polar lipids, including those from dairy, play a critical role in cognitive development through mechanisms like signal transduction and myelination. Supplementation with gangliosides and phospholipids showed some positive effects on cognitive performance in animals and infants, but more clinical research is needed.
population_specificity: Infants, pregnant/lactating mothers, and adults (general dietary sources).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether lactose-free products reduce lactose absorption capacity and if lactose-absorbers should avoid them, while also examining the effects of lactose withdrawal and colonic adaptation in lactase-deficient individuals.
results_summary: The study found that endogenous lactase expression is not influenced by dietary lactose, but lactose feeding in lactase-deficient individuals supports colonic adaptation, potentially reducing intolerance symptoms. Withdrawing lactose may lower tolerance thresholds upon reintroduction.
population_specificity: Adults with lactase deficiency (∼70% of global population) and lactose-absorbers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of milk biofortified with antioxidants (vitamin E and selenium) on the health of children, comparing different dietary treatments in dairy cows and their resulting milk.
results_summary: Cows fed diets with added antioxidants (COANT and OANT) produced milk with higher selenium and vitamin E concentrations. The study evaluated the health impact of this milk on children over 84 days, though specific health outcomes are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: 100 children aged 8 to 10 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether low-fat dairy foods or calcium + vitamin D supplements, combined with hypocaloric diets, could influence weight-loss-related outcomes in overweight/obese early-postmenopausal women.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results, only stating that previous studies have not reached a consensus on dairy and calcium's role in weight and body composition.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese Caucasian, early-postmenopausal women.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how high-fat dairy cream, alone or combined with glucose or fructose, acutely affects hepatic fat content (HFC) in healthy subjects.
results_summary: High-fat dairy cream alone increased HFC significantly, and combining it with fructose further elevated HFC, while glucose coadministration with dairy cream prevented this increase. Repeated glucose doses alone reduced HFC.
population_specificity: 10 healthy nonsteatotic male volunteers (age 38.5 ± 9.6 y, BMI 26.9 ± 2.7).
effective_dosage: 150 g of dairy cream (single dose) or combined with 50 g glucose/fructose (3 doses at 0, 2, and 4 h).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the influence of maternal milk and dairy consumption on pregnancy and lactation outcomes in healthy women.
results_summary: Maternal milk intake during pregnancy appears positively associated with infant birth weight and length, but insufficient data prevents conclusions on preterm deliveries, spontaneous abortion, and lactation.
population_specificity: Healthy pregnant and lactating women.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationship between dairy product intake and linear growth and bone mineral content in children and adolescents.
results_summary: The systematic review found that supplementing the diet with dairy products significantly increased bone mineral content during childhood, but the evidence regarding dairy's effect on linear growth was inconclusive.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the decontamination power of NaOCl, aqueous-O3, and PAA against Salmonella on various surfaces in dairy operations.
results_summary: NaOCl, aqueous-O3, and PAA reduced Salmonella contamination to safe levels on plastic and nylon surfaces within 4 minutes. PAA and aqueous-O3 outperformed NaOCl on rubber and wood surfaces, with PAA showing the highest efficacy on wood.
population_specificity: Cattle manure-contaminated surfaces (plastic, nylon, rubber, and wood) in dairy operations.
effective_dosage: 200 ppm NaOCl, 9 ppm aqueous-O3, or 400 ppm PAA for 4 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the effects of consuming fortified dairy products on biomarkers of cardiometabolic risk, focusing on phytosterols, fatty acids, and vitamin D.
results_summary: Consumption of phytosterol-fortified dairy reduced LDL cholesterol by -0.36 mmol/L, while ω-3 FA-fortified dairy reduced LDL cholesterol by -0.18 mmol/L and triacylglycerols by -0.18 mmol/L. Limited data prevented meta-analysis for vitamin D and non-ω-3 FA fortified dairy.
population_specificity: Human subjects in randomized clinical trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize evidence on the influence of dairy product consumption on major cardiovascular-related outcomes and biomarkers, including blood pressure and blood lipids.
results_summary: The study found no significant adverse association between dairy consumption (regular or low-fat) and cardiovascular disease risk, with some evidence of a negative association (RR <1) or no significant effect. Meta-analyses of RCTs also showed no significant changes in cardiovascular risk biomarkers.
population_specificity: General population (based on meta-analyses of cohort studies and RCTs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the associations between dairy product consumption and colorectal cancer (CRC) incidence, focusing on different types of dairy products and CRC locations.
results_summary: Higher consumption of total dairy products and total milk was associated with a lower risk of CRC, while low-fat milk and cheese showed protective associations for specific CRC locations. No significant associations were found for low-fat dairy, whole milk, fermented dairy, or cultured milk.
population_specificity: Over 22,000 cases from 15 cohort studies and 14 case-control studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of milk and dairy products on inflammatory biomarkers in healthy individuals and those with metabolic abnormalities.
results_summary: The study found that dairy consumption did not show a proinflammatory effect and, in most cases, demonstrated a significant anti-inflammatory effect in both healthy and metabolically abnormal subjects. However, not all studies included were of high quality.
population_specificity: Healthy individuals, overweight or obese subjects, and those with metabolic syndrome or type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of dairy product intake in preventing cognitive decline, sarcopenia, and frailty in the elderly population.
results_summary: Dairy consumption may reduce the risk of frailty and sarcopenia, particularly with high intake of low-fat milk and yogurt, but findings on cognitive decline were mixed, with some negative associations (e.g., dairy desserts and ice cream) and one positive association (dairy intake and reduced Alzheimer's disease risk).
population_specificity: Community-dwelling older people (elderly population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the postprandial and overnight glycemic response between a novel green aquatic plant-based shake and an iso-carbohydrate/protein/caloric dairy shake.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results regarding Dairy's effects.
population_specificity: 20 abdominally obese participants (average age 51.4 years; fasting plasma glucose 110.9 mg/dL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of dairy product intake, specifically cow's milk, on exercise performance and recovery of muscle function in humans.
results_summary: The study found mixed results, with some studies showing significant positive effects of cow's milk on exercise performance and muscle recovery, while others found no effect. The inconsistencies were attributed to variations in milk ingestion, intervention types, and outcome measures.
population_specificity: Humans undergoing resistance and endurance exercises.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the prevalence of Shiga toxin-producing Escherichia coli (STEC) in dairy cattle herds and compare it with beef cattle and sheep, while also analyzing virulence genes and antimicrobial resistance profiles.
results_summary: STEC was less frequently isolated from dairy cattle herds (30.5%) compared to beef cattle (63.5%) and sheep (56.5%). Dairy-associated STEC strains showed lower antimicrobial resistance (5.2%) compared to human isolates (21.9%), but virulence gene distribution differed between animal and human strains.
population_specificity: Dairy cattle herds (82 herds surveyed).

study_goal: To assess the effects of fortifying staple foods, including dairy, with vitamin A on reducing vitamin A deficiency and improving health-related outcomes in the general population over two years of age.
results_summary: Fortifying staple foods with vitamin A alone may make little or no difference to serum retinol concentrations or the risk of subclinical vitamin A deficiency. Fortification with vitamin A plus other micronutrients probably reduces the risk of subclinical vitamin A deficiency compared to unfortified foods.
population_specificity: General population older than two years, including pregnant and lactating women, from low- and middle-income countries where vitamin A deficiency is a public health issue.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of dairy, in amounts usually consumed, on satiety and postprandial glycaemia in healthy young adults.
results_summary: Dairy proteins reduced appetite and improved postprandial glycaemic response in healthy young adults, though the study noted a lack of prior reports on typical consumption amounts.
population_specificity: 30 healthy young adults (age: 23.5 ± 0.5 years; BMI: 21.8 ± 0.4 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether urinary phosphorus excretion varies across different dietary patterns, including one rich in low-fat dairy (DASH diet), to determine its suitability as a biomarker for dietary phosphorus intake.
results_summary: The study found that the DASH diet (rich in low-fat dairy) significantly increased phosphorus intake and altered urinary phosphorus excretion patterns compared to control and fruit/vegetable-rich diets, suggesting urinary phosphorus excretion is not a reliable biomarker for dietary intake.
population_specificity: 459 prehypertensive and stage 1 hypertensive adults (52% male, 56% black).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare clinical scoring by a veterinarian with treatment decisions by on-farm personnel to assess the appropriateness of antimicrobial use in calves with diarrhea.
results_summary: The study found high treatment rates (85%) for calves, mostly with antimicrobials, despite low probabilities of treatment being associated with clinical signs. There was significant incongruity between farm personnel's treatment decisions and clinical scoring by a veterinarian.
population_specificity: 460 calves from birth to age 28 days on 4 dairy farms.

study_goal: The study does not investigate Dairy; it focuses on the efficacy and safety of electroacupuncture for treating insomnia in depressed patients.
results_summary: The study does not report findings related to Dairy.
population_specificity: Depressed patients with insomnia in Shanghai healthcare centers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate existing dietary recommendations, including dairy elimination, for managing hidradenitis suppurativa (HS).
